intro: Scorpioides glaber, commonly known as the rough scorpioid, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its upright growth habit and hairy stems. The plant produces showy, tubular flowers that are typically red or orange in color, attracting pollinators such as birds and insects. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its rough texture. Scorpioides glaber is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its striking appearance and adaptability to various soil types.
